fields.description: It seems the SC isn't cleaning old target not anymore in use. This is specially important for the equallogic since each target is a LUN.
fields.summary: we should clean the iscsi target not any more in use

comments.body: confirming that this has been addressed in a future release.
Neil, can you confirm, I believe you indicated that this was resolved in 3.2.  Is there a bug we can link this to as a duplicate and resolve?
Once detached it is still around on NC. Unrelated to 3.2 fix we need to investigate why NC detach is possibly failing.
Similar to euca-2991

See  euca-2991.
Could not duplicate with 3.2.1 using Walrus storage method.
Darren/John, are we talking about iSCSI targets left behind on the SC or iSCSI sessions left behind on the NC(s)?
I was looking only at SC

Upon further investigation, there appears NO  stale iSCSI threads left on the NC after a run of launching/terminating esb instances:


{noformat}

There appears to be stale information 
left behind on the NC in /var 

{noformat}

find /var/lib/iscsi/

/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.cluster01:store1976
/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.cluster01:store1976/10.101.1.13,


that are reported by issciamdm -m node ; but there are no lingering iscsi kernel threads 

{noformat}
yes, the bug referred to target left behind on the NC. Is there any problem if we try to re-attach those target on other hosts (NC)?
[~graziano] if the session has been disconnected, there should be no issue if you re-attach from another client.

from the iscsiadm man:


/var/lib/iscsi/nodes/
              This directory contains the nodes with their targets.

The reminiscent are  used by -m node option; These are not created by Eucalyptus.
The behavior is from a cli utility not provided by Eucalyptus.  It has no negative impact on operation.
great, thanks for the feedback.

I did some unit testing and it is possible to clean up stale iscsi 
sessions with minor changes to disconnect-iscsi-target.pl . We should 
pursue this solution.
Posted dev/jpdonnelly/EUCA-3782  branch for review

John, the issue we need to be careful about is that often the node is shared for a bunch of LUNs.  As long as iscsi operations are serialized on the NC it shouldn't be a problem, but we need to be sure that we are only removing nodes that are no longer being used.

For Equallogic and SC/TGT each LUN has its own node/target record. But, for Netapp and EMC the same target is used (i.e. same IQN) for all luns hosted on that SAN and different attachements are simply different LUNs within the target. We just need to be sure we handle both cases cleanly.

I looked at the branch and the fix looks good. It only removes the node if it was just logged-out of anyway, so there should be no problems with shared node records.

Is this intended for a 3.2.2 fix or in 3.3? Once we know we should merge it in and continue testing. It will be easy enough to revert if something weird does result.

{noformat}
[jpdonnelly@b-11 internal]$  git push origin maint/3.2/testing

approved by Zach

[~jdonnelly]

Do you have steps to reproduce this issue reliably?

Vic: When a instance terminates, the corresponding /var/lib/iscsi/nodes/ IGN directory 
on the NC should be removed;

Verified that when attached an entry is properly displayed in the nodes directory, then after the detachment the entry disappears:

[root@h-20 ~]# euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME  vol-554C3FF4     2              PARTI00 in-use  2013-03-21T17:34:27.564Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-554C3FF4    i-46CA4365      /dev/vdb        attached        2013-03-21T17:42:13.598Z
VOLUME  vol-A3E23F3A     2              PARTI00 in-use  2013-03-21T17:34:25.443Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-A3E23F3A    i-46CA4365      /dev/vdc        attached        2013-03-21T17:42:20.137Z
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-A3E23F3A
VOLUME  vol-A3E23F3A
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-describe-nodes
NODE    10.111.5.29     CC_27
NODE    10.111.5.31     CC_27   i-46CA4365
[root@h-20 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-554C3FF4
VOLUME  vol-554C3FF4


[root@h-31 ~]# ll /var/lib/iscsi/nodes/
total 4
drw------- 2 root root 4096 Mar 21 10:42 iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.PARTI00:store9
[root@h-31 ~]# ll /var/lib/iscsi/nodes/
total 0
[root@h-31 ~]#
3.2.2 has been released, moving this to Resolved.
